intro: Kallstroemia tribuloides, commonly known as the goldenstar, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slight pubescence. Kallstroemia tribuloides thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
